section.title: Task Service API
section.para: The human task service exposes a Java API for managing the life cycle of tasks. This allows clients to integrate (at a low level) with the human task service. Note that end users should probably not interact with this low-level API directly, but use one of the more user-friendly task clients (see below) instead. These clients offer a graphical user interface to request task lists, claim and complete tasks, and manage tasks in general. The task clients listed below use the Java API to internally interact with the human task service. Of course, the low-level API is also available so that developers can use it in their code to interact with the human task service directly.

listitem.para: taskId: The id of the task that we are working with. This is usually extracted from the currently selected task in the user task list in the user interface.
userId: The id of the user that is executing the action. This is usually the id of the user that is logged in into the application.
